==Trivia==
* This subarea's name isn't shown on map until completion of the quest ''[[For Fruits, Seeds, and Trees]]''.
===Etymology===
*According to Hindu scriptures, {{Lang|''Aśvattha''|sa=अश्वत्थ}} or ''{{W|Ficus religiosa|sacred fig}}'' (''Ficus religiosa''), is a sacred tree for the Hindus and has been extensively mentioned in texts pertaining to Hinduism. The fire sticks used in Hindu sacrificial fire like ''{{w|Agnihotra}}'' also contain dried wood of ashvattha tree.
